hints_html:
The y coordinate of the centroid is computed using the formula

\[\begin{aligned} \bar{y}=\frac{1}{A}\int_{a}^{b}\frac{1}{2}(f(x)^2-g(x)^{2})dx\end{aligned}\]

where A is the area.
hints_raw:
The ''y'' coordinate of the centroid is computed using the formula

:<math>\displaystyle{\bar{y}=\frac{1}{A}\int_{a}^{b}\frac{1}{2}(f(x)^2-g(x)^{2})dx}</math>

where ''A'' is the area.
question: 2 (b)
sols_html:
Plugging in all the values gives

\[\begin{aligned} \bar{y}&=\frac{3}{7}\int_{-1}^{1}\frac{1}{2}\left((2-x^2)^2-(|x|)^{2}\right)dx\\ &=\frac{3}{14}\int_{-1}^{1} \left(4-4x^2+x^4-x^2\right)dx\\ &=\frac{3}{14}\int_{-1}^{1}(4-5x^2+x^4)dx\end{aligned}\]

completing the question.
